title: Setup GitHub issue and PR templates
description:
**As a** open source contributor
**I want** issue and PR templates in the repository
**So that** I can provide complete information when contributing

**Context:**
.github/ directory exists but may be missing standard templates. Public repositories should have:
- Bug report template
- Feature request template
- Pull request template
- Contributing guidelines link

These improve issue quality and make triage easier.

**Technical Notes:**
- Directory: .github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/ and .github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE/
- GitHub supports YAML-based issue forms (recommended)
- Can also use classic Markdown templates
- Reference: https://docs.github.com/en/communities/using-templates-to-encourage-useful-issues-and-pull-requests

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Given** a user creates a new issue on GitHub
**When** they click "New Issue"
**Then** they see templates for Bug Report and Feature Request

**Given** a contributor creates a PR
**When** they open the PR form
**Then** a template guides them to provide description, testing, and checklist

**Given** templates are created
**When** I review them
**Then** they follow GitHub best practices and include all necessary fields

**Testing Considerations:**
- Test on actual GitHub repository (may need to push to test)
- Verify templates appear in issue/PR creation UI
- Check that required fields are marked
- Ensure templates are mobile-friendly

**Implementation Hints:**
Create these files:
```
.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/
  ├── bug_report.yml
  ├── feature_request.yml
  └── config.yml

.github/
  └── PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md
```

**Bug Report Template** should include:
- Consoul version
- Python version
- OS/platform
- Steps to reproduce
- Expected vs actual behavior
- Error messages/logs

**Feature Request Template** should include:
- Problem description
- Proposed solution
- Alternatives considered
- Additional context

**PR Template** should include:
- Description of changes
- Related issue/ticket (SOUL-XXX)
- Type of change (bug fix, feature, docs)
- Testing performed
- Checklist (tests pass, docs updated, etc.)
